item.title: Mapping a Cloud Run Service to a Custom Domain
item.description:
When you deploy a service to Cloud Run, you are provided with a default domain to access the service. However, you can use your own domain or subdomain instead of the default one. So in this tutorial, I'll map a custom domain to a Cloud Run service.

In the Cloud Run services page, Click MANAGE CUSTOM DOMAINS

In the Domain Mappings page, click ADD MAPPING

In the Add Mapping form, select the service you are mapping the custom domain to, and your domain name. If your domain is not verified, you'll be required to do it as shown below. Click VERIFY IN WEBMASTER CENTRAL to do it.

The verification takes a couple of minutes. Click REFRESH to check if it's done.

When verification completes successfully, specify the domain or subdomain to map to the service you have selected, then click CONTINUE.

You are provided with the DNS records for the custom domain that maps to your Cloud Run service. You'll need to add these records to the host records at your domain registrar.

Copy the DNS records, log in to your domain registrar, go to the host records section of your domain's configuration page and then add the records. Depending on your registrar and the TTL configured in your DNS records, can take a few minutes or several for the changes to take effect.

Finally, when the DNS records have been successfully updated, you can use your custom domain to access your deployed Cloud Run service.

When you map a Cloud Run service to a custom domain, an SSL certificate is issued and managed for you automatically. The connections to and from your service are secured.

For more details about a Cloud Run service to a custom domain check out the Google Cloud documentation on mapping custom domains.
